weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a heavy blanket of clouds, where the patter of rain insinuates itself as a constant companion. The temperature hovers around a cool 57, gradually descending as the hours wane, lending a chill to the air that suggests it is best to don a warm, water-resistant jacket if you venture outdoors. The winds from the west whip briskly at 16 mph, carrying with them the scent of the bay, while gusts might surprise you, urging a tighter grip on your umbrella.

In this dim light, as the day darkens, the forecast promises not just the persistent rain but offers a short glimpse into the evening, with showers expected to linger into the night. The air feels dense with moisture, hinting at the presence of fog lurking nearby, particularly around the iconic Golden Gate, where the marine layer often blurs the line between sea and sky. A cozy afternoon with a warm cup of tea or coffee might just be the remedy for this weather. Root yourself in a nook of your favorite café, perhaps one with a view of the rain-soaked streets, and enjoy a good book, letting the sounds of the city merge with the rhythm of the rain—after all, there is a beauty in the stillness of a storm that begs for quiet reflection.
